thread.section_title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic set to stay at Manchester United after reassurances over title tilt – Metro
thread.title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic set to stay at Manchester United after reassurances over title tilt
thread.title_full: Zlatan Ibrahimovic set to stay at Manchester United after reassurances over title tilt

author: Coral Barry
title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic set to stay at Manchester United after reassurances over title tilt
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been a revelation at Manchester United this season (Picture: Getty) Manchester United have convinced Zlatan Ibrahimovic that they are serious about a Premier League title tilt next season, according to reports in Sweden.
Arsenal make offer to world class manager about replacing Arsene Wenger The 35-year-old signed a one-year deal last summer and United have been working tirelessly to make sure Ibrahimovic stays a further season.
Ibrahimovic is the club’s top scorer, but has been disappointed with United’s league form this campaign.
United are rooted in sixth and have played no part in the title race with Jose Mourinho still tinkering with his new side.
Ibrahimovic has netted 26 goals in all competitions for United (Picture: Getty) And Ibrahimovic has been looking for assurances that United are serious about challenging next season with the Swede desperate to add the Premier League to his trophy case.
Ibrahimovic has won the league title in Spain, Italy and France and is targeting England’s league silverware as his next major achievement.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
More: Football Jamie Redknapp names the TWO teams who will miss out on the top four 
Monaco star will reject Manchester United to sign for Chelsea 
Chile set to RISK Alexis Sanchez despite Arsenal's ligament damage fears 
Swedish publication Expressen claim that United have met the concerns of Ibrahimovic and have convinced their star attacker to remain for at least another season.
Ibrahimovic has already scored 26 goals in all competitions, but is currently serving a three-match ban for an elbow on Bournemouth defender Tyrone Mings.
It is also believed that Ibrahimovic will sign a two-year deal at the club as the frontman targets firing United back into the Champions League.
MORE: Arsenal and Manchester United will miss out on top four finish, says Jamie Redknapp
